member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX
member.summary: The ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX structure is used in conjunction with an request to instruct the port driver to send an embedded ATA command to the target device.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.Length
member.summary: Specifies the length in bytes of the ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.AtaFlags
member.summary: Indicates the direction of data transfer and specifies the kind of operation to be performed.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.PathId
member.summary: Contains an integer that indicates the IDE port or bus for the request. This value is set by the port driver.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.TargetId
member.summary: Contains an integer that indicates the target device on the bus. This value is set by the port driver.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.Lun
member.summary: Indicates the logical unit number of the device. This value is set by the port driver.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.ReservedAsUchar
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.DataTransferLength
member.summary: Indicates the size, in bytes, of the data buffer. If an underrun occurs, the miniport driver must update this member to the number of bytes that were actually transferred.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.TimeOutValue
member.summary: Indicates the number of seconds that are allowed for the request to execute before the OS-specific port driver determines that the request has timed out.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.ReservedAsUlong
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.DataBufferOffset
member.summary: Specifies the offset, in bytes, from the beginning of this structure to the data buffer.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.PreviousTaskFile
member.summary: Specifies the contents of the task file input registers prior to the current pass-through command.
member.remarks: This member is not used when the ATA_FLAGS_48BIT_COMMAND flag is not set.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.CurrentTaskFile
member.summary: Specifies the content of the task file register on both input and output.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff551323%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.AtaPassThroughFlags
member.summary: Indicates the direction of data transfer and specifies the kind of operation to be performed.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.AtaPassThroughFlags.DRDY_REQUIRED
member.summary: Wait for DRDY status from the device before sending the command to the device.

member.summary: Read data from the device.

member.summary: Write data to the device.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.AtaAPI.ATA_PASS_THROUGH_EX.AtaPassThroughFlags._48BIT_COMMAND
member.summary: The ATA command to be sent uses the 48-bit logical block address (LBA) feature set.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.METHOD
member.summary: Define the method codes for how buffers are passed for I/O and FS controls

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.METHOD.BUFFERED
member.summary: Specifies the buffered I/O method, which is typically used for transferring small amounts of data per request.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.METHOD.IN_DIRECT
member.summary: Specifies the direct I/O method, which is typically used for reading or writing large amounts of data, using DMA or PIO, that must be transferred quickly.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.METHOD.OUT_DIRECT
member.summary: Specifies the direct I/O method, which is typically used for reading or writing large amounts of data, using DMA or PIO, that must be transferred quickly.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.METHOD.NEITHER
member.summary: Specifies neither buffered nor direct I/O. The I/O manager does not provide any system buffers or MDLs. The IRP supplies the user-mode virtual addresses of the input and output buffers that were specified to DeviceIoControl or IoBuildDeviceIoControlRequest, without validating or mapping them.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.STARTING_LCN_INPUT_BUFFER
member.summary: Contains the starting LCN to the control code.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.STARTING_LCN_INPUT_BUFFER.StartingLcn
member.summary: The LCN from which the operation should start when describing a bitmap. This member will be rounded down to a file-system-dependent rounding boundary, and that value will be returned.
member.remarks: Its value should be an integral multiple of eight.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.VOLUME_BITMAP_BUFFER
member.summary: Represents the occupied and available clusters on a disk. This structure is the output buffer for the control code.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365726%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.VOLUME_BITMAP_BUFFER.StartingLcn
member.summary: Starting LCN requested as an input to the operation.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.VOLUME_BITMAP_BUFFER.BitmapSize
member.summary: The number of clusters on the volume, starting from the starting LCN returned in the StartingLcn member of this structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.VOLUME_BITMAP_BUFFER.Buffer
member.summary: Array of bytes containing the bitmap that the operation returns. The bitmap is bitwise from bit zero of the bitmap to the end. Thus, starting at the requested cluster, the bitmap goes from bit 0 of byte 0, bit 1 of byte 0 ... bit 7 of byte 0, bit 0 of byte 1, and so on. The value 1 indicates that the cluster is allocated (in use). The value 0 indicates that the cluster is not allocated (free).
member.remarks: Необходимо возвращать массив байт, а на массив байт накладывать первую структуру, а затем читать буфер. Но если разбить на куски, скажем, по 512 байт, то чтение всего массива может занять несколько минут. Проще сразу передать достаточно большой массив.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS
member.summary: Contains statistical information from the file system.
member.remarks: There are two types of files: user and metadata. User files are available for the user. Metadata files are system files that contain information, which the file system uses for its internal organization. The number of read and write operations measured is the number of paging operations.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS.FileSystemType
member.summary: The type of file system.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS.Version
member.summary: This member is set to 1 (one).

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS.SizeOfCompleteStructure
member.summary: The size of this structure plus the size of the file system-specific structure that follows this structure, multiplied by the number of processors.
member.remarks: This value must be a multiple of 64. For example, if the size of FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS is 0x38, the size of NTFS_STATISTICS is 0xd4, and if there are 2 processors, the buffer allocated must be 0x280. sizeof(FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS) = 0x38 sizeof(NTFS_STATISTICS) = 0xd4 Total Size = 0x10c size of the complete structure = 0x140 (which is the aligned length, a multiple of 64) multiplied by 2 (the number of processors) = 0x280

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.FsctlAPI.FILESYSTEM_STATISTICS.UserFileReads
member.summary: The number of read operations on user files.

member.summary: The number of bytes read from user files.

member.name: M:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.Methods.CreateFile(System.String,AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.FILE_ACCESS_FLAGS,AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.FILE_SHARE,System.IntPtr,AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.CreateDisposition,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates or opens a file or I/O device. The most commonly used I/O devices are as follows: file, file stream, directory, physical disk, volume, console buffer, tape drive, communications resource, mailslot, and pipe. The function returns a handle that can be used to access the file or device for various types of I/O depending on the file or device and the flags and attributes specified.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363858%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: The name of the file or device to be created or opened. You may use either forward slashes (/) or backslashes (\) in this name.
The requested access to the file or device, which can be summarized as read, write, both or neither zero).

The requested sharing mode of the file or device, which can be read, write, both, delete, all of these, or none (refer to the following table). Access requests to attributes or extended attributes are not affected by this flag.

A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that contains two separate but related data members: an optional security descriptor, and a Boolean value that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes.
An action to take on a file or device that exists or does not exist.
The file or device attributes and flags, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL being the most common default value for files.
A valid handle to a template file with the GENERIC_READ access right. The template file supplies file attributes and extended attributes for the file that is being created.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is an open handle to the specified file, device, named pipe, or mail slot.

member.summary: Opens specified device

member.summary: Opens specified device

member.name: M:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.Methods.GetDriveTypeA(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a disk drive is a removable, fixed, CD-ROM, RAM disk, or network drive.
member.remarks: To determine whether a drive is a USB-type drive, call SetupDiGetDeviceRegistryProperty and specify the SPDRP_REMOVAL_POLICY property.
member.param: The root directory for the drive. A trailing backslash is required. If this parameter is NULL, the function uses the root of the current directory.
member.returns: The return value specifies the type of drive.

member.name: M:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.Methods.DeviceIoControl(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@,System.Threading.NativeOverlapped@)
member.summary: Sends a control code directly to a specified device driver, causing the corresponding device to perform the corresponding operation.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363216%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: A handle to the device on which the operation is to be performed. The device is typically a volume, directory, file, or stream.
The control code for the operation. This value identifies the specific operation to be performed and the type of device on which to perform it.

A pointer to the input buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation. The format of this data depends on the value of the dwIoControlCode parameter. This parameter can be NULL if dwIoControlCode specifies an operation that does not require input data.
The size of the input buffer, in bytes.

A pointer to the output buffer that is to receive the data returned by the operation. The format of this data depends on the value of the dwIoControlCode parameter. This parameter can be NULL if dwIoControlCode specifies an operation that does not return data.
The size of the output buffer, in bytes.
A pointer to a variable that receives the size of the data stored in the output buffer, in bytes.
A pointer to an OVERLAPPED structure. If hDevice was opened without specifying FILE_FLAG_OVERLAPPED, lpOverlapped is ignored.
member.returns: If the operation completes successfully, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.Methods.DeviceIoControl``1(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Object,System.UInt32@,``0@)
member.summary: Sends a control code directly to a specified device driver, causing the corresponding device to perform the corresponding operation.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa363216%28v=vs.85%29.aspx
member.param: A handle to the device on which the operation is to be performed. The device is typically a volume, directory, file, or stream.
The control code for the operation. This value identifies the specific operation to be performed and the type of device on which to perform it.

A pointer to the input buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation. The format of this data depends on the value of the dwIoControlCode parameter. This parameter can be NULL if dwIoControlCode specifies an operation that does not require input data.
A pointer to a variable that receives the size of the data stored in the output buffer, in bytes.

A pointer to the output buffer that is to receive the data returned by the operation. The format of this data depends on the value of the dwIoControlCode parameter. This parameter can be NULL if dwIoControlCode specifies an operation that does not return data.
member.returns: If the operation completes successfully, the return value is nonzero.

member.name: M:AlphaOmega.Debug.Constant.CTL_CODE(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.FILE_ACCESS)
member.summary: This macro is used to create a unique system I/O control code (IOCTL).
member.param: Defines the type of device for the given IOCTL. This parameter can be no bigger then a WORD value. The values used by Microsoft are in the range 0-32767 and the values 32768-65535 are reserved for use by OEMs and IHVs.
Defines an action within the device category. That function codes 0-2047 are reserved for Microsoft, and 2048-4095 are reserved for OEMs and IHVs. The function code can be no larger then 4095.
Defines the access check value for any access.
member.remarks: The macro can be used for defining IOCTL and FSCTL function control codes. All IOCTLs must be defined this way to ensure that no overlaps occur between Microsoft and OEMs and IHVs.

member.name: M:AlphaOmega.Debug.Constant.CTL_CODE(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.METHOD,AlphaOmega.Debug.WinAPI.FILE_ACCESS)
member.summary: This macro is used to create a unique system I/O control code (IOCTL).
member.param: Defines the type of device for the given IOCTL. This parameter can be no bigger then a WORD value. The values used by Microsoft are in the range 0-32767 and the values 32768-65535 are reserved for use by OEMs and IHVs.
Defines an action within the device category. That function codes 0-2047 are reserved for Microsoft, and 2048-4095 are reserved for OEMs and IHVs. The function code can be no larger then 4095.
Defines the method codes for how buffers are passed for I/O and file system controls.
Defines the access check value for any access.
member.remarks: The macro can be used for defining IOCTL and FSCTL function control codes. All IOCTLs must be defined this way to ensure that no overlaps occur between Microsoft and OEMs and IHVs.

member.summary: Increments a reference counter that enables the collection of disk performance statistics, such as the numbers of bytes read and written since the driver last processed this request, for a corresponding disk monitoring application. In Microsoft Windows 2000 this IOCTL is handled by the filter driver diskperf. In Windows XP and later operating systems, the partition manager handles this request for disks and ftdisk.sys and dmio.sys handle this request for volumes.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365183%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Constant.IOCTL_DISC.PERFORMANCE_OFF
member.summary: Disables the counters that were enabled by previous calls to IOCTL_DISK_PERFORMANCE. This request is available in Windows XP and later operating systems. Caller must be running at IRQL = PASSIVE_LEVEL.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365184%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Constant.IOCTL_STORAGE.PREDICT_FAILURE
member.summary: Polls for a prediction of device failure.
member.remarks: This request works with the IDE disk drives that support self-monitoring analysis and reporting technology (SMART). If the drive is a SCSI drive, the class driver attempts to verify if the SCSI disk supports the equivalent IDE SMART technology by check the inquiry information on the Information Exception Control Page, X3T10/94-190 Rev 4.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Constant.IOCTL_STORAGE.QUERY_PROPERTY
member.summary: Returns properties of a storage device or adapter. The request indicates the kind of information to retrieve, such as inquiry data for a device or capabilities and limitations of an adapter.
member.remarks: can also be used to determine whether the port driver supports a particular property or which fields in the property descriptor can be modified with a subsequent change-property request. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff560590%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DETECTION_TYPE
member.summary: The DETECTION_TYPE enumeration type is used in conjunction with the IOCTL_DISK_GET_DRIVE_GEOMETRY_EX request and the DISK_GEOMETRY_EX structure to determine the type of formatting used by the BIOS to record the disk geometry.
member.remarks: Possible formatting types are the standard INT 13h partition format or the extended INT 13h partition format.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DETECTION_TYPE.DetectNone
member.summary: Indicates that the disk contains neither an INT 13h partition nor an extended INT 13h partition.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DETECTION_TYPE.DetectInt13
member.summary: Indicates that the disk has a standard INT 13h partition.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DETECTION_TYPE.DetectExInt13
member.summary: Indicates that the disk contains an extended INT 13h partition.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_INT13_INFO
member.summary: The DISK_INT13_INFO structure is used by the BIOS to report disk detection data for a partition with an INT13 format.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_INT13_INFO.DriveSelect
member.summary: Corresponds to the Device/Head register defined in the AT Attachment (ATA) specification. When zero, the fourth bit of this register indicates that drive zero is selected. When 1, it indicates that drive one is selected. The values of bits 0, 1, 2, 3, and 6 depend on the command in the command register. Bits 5 and 7 are no longer used. For more information about the values that the Device/Head register can hold, see the ATA specification.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_INT13_INFO.MaxCylinders
member.summary: Indicates the maximum number of cylinders on the disk.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_INT13_INFO.SectorsPerTrack
member.summary: Indicates the number of sectors per track.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_INT13_INFO.MaxHeads
member.summary: Indicates the maximum number of disk heads.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_INT13_INFO.NumberDrives
member.summary: Indicates the number of drives.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO
member.summary: The DISK_EX_INT13_INFO structure is used by the BIOS to report disk detection data for a partition with an extended INT13 format.
member.remarks: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/hardware/ff552610%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExBufferSize
member.summary: Indicates the size of the buffer that the caller provides to the BIOS in which to return the requested drive data. ExBufferSize must be 26 or greater. If ExBufferSize is less than 26, the BIOS returns an error. If ExBufferSize is between 30 and 66, the BIOS sets it to exactly 30 on exit. If ExBufferSize is 66 or greater, the BIOS sets it to exactly 66 on exit.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExFlags
member.summary: Provides information about the drive. The following table describes the significance of each bit, where bit 0 is the least significant bit and bit 15 the most significant bit. A value of one in the indicated bit means that the feature described in the "Meaning" column is available. A value of zero in the indicated bit means that the feature is not available with this drive.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExCylinders
member.summary: Indicates the number of physical cylinders. This is one greater than the maximum cylinder number.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExHeads
member.summary: Indicates the number of physical heads. This is one greater than the maximum head number.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExSectorsPerTrack
member.summary: Indicates the number of physical sectors per track. This number is the same as the maximum sector number.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExSectorsPerDrive
member.summary: Indicates the total count of sectors on the disk. This is one greater than the maximum logical block address.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExSectorSize
member.summary: Indicates the sector size in bytes.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_EX_INT13_INFO.ExReserved
member.summary: Reserved

member.summary: Mbr

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.MbrType.Signature
member.summary: Specifies the signature value, which uniquely identifies the disk. The Mbr member of the union is used to specify the disk signature data for a disk formatted with a Master Boot Record (MBR) format partition table. Any other value indicates that the partition is not a boot partition.
member.remarks: This member is valid when PartitionStyle is PARTITION_STYLE.MBR.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.MbrType.CheckSum
member.summary: Specifies the checksum for the master boot record. The Mbr member of the union is used to specify the disk signature data for a disk formatted with a Master Boot Record (MBR) format partition table.
member.remarks: This member is valid when PartitionStyle is PARTITION_STYLE.MBR.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.GptType
member.summary: Gpt

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.GptType.DiskId
member.summary: Specifies the GUID that uniquely identifies the disk. The Gpt member of the union is used to specify the disk signature data for a disk that is formatted with a GUID Partition Table (GPT) format partition table.
member.remarks: This member is valid when PartitionStyle is PARTITION_STYLE_GPT.

member.remarks: It is the output buffer for the IOCTL_DISK_VERIFY control code.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.VERIFY_INFORMATION.StartingOffset
member.summary: The starting offset of the disk extent.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.VERIFY_INFORMATION.Length
member.summary: The length of the disk extent, in bytes.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE
member.summary: The DISK_PERFORMANCE structure is used in conjunction with the IOCTL_DISK_PERFORMANCE request to collect summary disk statistics for purposes of measuring disk performance.
member.remarks: Counting halts whenever the performance counters are disabled, but the counters are not reset, so the cumulative values assigned to the structure members might potentially reflect disk activity across several enablings and disablings of the counters.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.BytesRead
member.summary: Contains a cumulative count of bytes read from the disk since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.BytesWritten
member.summary: Contains a cumulative count of bytes written to the disk since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.ReadTime
member.summary: Contains a cumulative time, expressed in increments of 100 nanoseconds, spent on disk reads since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.WriteTime
member.summary: Contains a cumulative time, expressed in increments of 100 nanoseconds, spent on disk reads since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.IdleTime
member.summary: Contains a cumulative time, expressed in increments of 100 nanoseconds, since the performance counters were enabled in which there was no disk activity.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.ReadCount
member.summary: Contains the number of disk accesses for reads since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.WriteCount
member.summary: Contains the number of disk accesses for writes since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.QueueDepth
member.summary: Contains a snapshot of the number of queued disk I/O requests at the time that the query for performance statistics was performed.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.SplitCount
member.summary: Contains the number of disk accesses by means of an associated IRP since the performance counters were enabled.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.QueryTime
member.summary: Contains a timestamp indicating the system time at the moment that the query took place. System time is a count of 100-nanosecond intervals since January 1, 1601. System time is typically updated approximately every ten milliseconds.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.StorageDeviceNumber
member.summary: Contains a unique number assigned to every disk or volume across a particular storage type. The storage types are disk.sys, ftdisk.sys, and dmio.sys.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.DiscAPI.DISK_PERFORMANCE.StorageManagerName
member.summary: Contains an 8-character string that indicates which device driver provided the performance statistics. In Windows 2000, this can be either "LogiDisk" for the driver logidisk.sys or "PhysDisk" for the driver physdisk.sys. These drivers collect performance statistics for devices and physical disks respectively. In Windows XP and later operating systems, this can be any of the following three strings: "FTDISK" for the driver ftdisk.sys, "DMIO" for the driver dmio.sys, or PARTMGR" for the driver partmgr.sys. These three drivers collect performance statistics for basic disk volumes, dynamic disk volumes, and physical disks respectively. Note that these strings are 8-character case-sensitive strings with blank fill. For example, in the case of the string "FTDISK", the StorageManagerName character array should contain two trailing blanks ("FTDISK<b><b>"), and in the case of the string "DMIO", the array should contain four trailing blanks ("DMIO<b><b><b><b>").

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.VolumeAPI.VOLUME_DISK_EXTENTS.NumberOfDiskExtents
member.summary: The number of disks in the volume (a volume can span multiple disks).
member.remarks: An extent is a contiguous run of sectors on one disk. When the number of extents returned is greater than one (1), the error code ERROR_MORE_DATA is returned. member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: Device property descriptor - this is really just a rehash of the inquiry data retrieved from a scsi device.
member.remarks: This may only be retrieved from a target device. Sending this to the bus will result in an error.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.Version
member.summary: Contains the size of this structure, in bytes. The value of this member will change as members are added to the structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.Size
member.summary: Specifies the total size of the descriptor, in bytes, which may include vendor ID, product ID, product revision, device serial number strings and bus-specific data which are appended to the structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.DeviceType
member.summary: Specifies the device type as defined by the Small Computer Systems Interface (SCSI) specification.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.DeviceTypeModifier
member.summary: Specifies the device type modifier, if any, as defined by the SCSI specification.
member.remarks: If no device type modifier exists, this member is zero.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.RemovableMedia
member.summary: Indicates when TRUE that the device's media (if any) is removable. If the device has no media, this member should be ignored. When FALSE the device's media is not removable.
member.remarks: This field should be ignored for media-less devices.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.CommandQueueing
member.summary: Indicates when TRUE that the device supports multiple outstanding commands (SCSI tagged queuing or equivalent). When FALSE, the device does not support SCSI-tagged queuing or the equivalent.
member.remarks: The actual synchronization in this case is the responsibility of the port driver.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.VendorIdOffset
member.summary: Specifies the byte offset from the beginning of the structure to a null-terminated ASCII string that contains the device's vendor ID.
member.remarks: If the device has no vendor ID, this member is zero.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.ProductIdOffset
member.summary: Specifies the byte offset from the beginning of the structure to a null-terminated ASCII string that contains the device's product ID.
member.remarks: If the device has no product ID, this member is zero.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.ProductRevisionOffset
member.summary: Specifies the byte offset from the beginning of the structure to a null-terminated ASCII string that contains the device's product revision string.
member.remarks: If the device has no product revision string, this member is zero.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.SerialNumberOffset
member.summary: Specifies the byte offset from the beginning of the structure to a null-terminated ASCII string that contains the device's serial number.
member.remarks: If the device has no serial number, this member is zero.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_DESCRIPTOR.BusType

member.remarks: It should be used to interpret the raw device properties at the end of this structure (if any)

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_WRITE_CACHE_PROPERTY.WriteThroughSupported
member.summary: A value from the WRITE_THROUGH enumeration that indicates whether the device supports write-through caching.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_WRITE_CACHE_PROPERTY.FlushCacheSupported
member.summary: A BOOLEAN value that indicates whether the device allows host software to flush the device cache. If TRUE, the device allows host software to flush the device cache. If FALSE, host software cannot flush the device cache.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_WRITE_CACHE_PROPERTY.UserDefinedPowerProtection
member.summary: A BOOLEAN value that indicates whether a user can configure the device's power protection characteristics in the registry. If TRUE, a user can configure the device's power protection characteristics in the registry. If FALSE, the user cannot configure the device's power protection characteristics in the registry.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_WRITE_CACHE_PROPERTY.NVCacheEnabled
member.summary: A BOOLEAN value that indicates whether the device has a battery backup for the write cache. If TRUE, the device has a battery backup for the write cache. If FALSE, the device does not have a battery backup for the writer cache.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: Used with the control code request to retrieve the device ID descriptor data for a device.
member.remarks: The device ID descriptor consists of an array of device IDs taken from the SCSI-3 vital product data (VPD) page 0x83 that was retrieved during discovery.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_DESCRIPTOR.Version
member.summary: Contains the size of this structure, in bytes. The value of this member will change as members are added to the structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_DESCRIPTOR.Size
member.summary: Specifies the total size of the data returned, in bytes. This may include data that follows this structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_DESCRIPTOR.NumberOfIdentifiers
member.summary: Contains the number of identifiers reported by the device in the Identifiers array.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_DESCRIPTOR.Identifiers
member.summary: Contains a variable-length array of identification descriptors.

member.name: T:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR
member.summary: Used with the control code to retrieve the storage adapter descriptor data for a device.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.Version
member.summary: Contains the size of this structure, in bytes. The value of this member will change as members are added to the structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.Size
member.summary: Specifies the total size of the data returned, in bytes. This may include data that follows this structure.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.MaximumTransferLength
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of bytes the storage adapter can transfer in a single operation.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.MaximumPhysicalPages
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of discontinuous physical pages the storage adapter can manage in a single transfer (in other words, the extent of its scatter/gather support).

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AlignmentMask
member.summary: Specifies the storage adapter's alignment requirements for transfers.
member.remarks: The alignment mask indicates alignment restrictions for buffers required by the storage adapter for transfer operations. Valid mask values are also restricted by characteristics of the memory managers on different versions of Windows.
member.value: 0 - Buffers must be aligned on BYTE boundaries. 1 - Buffers must be aligned on WORD boundaries. 3 - Buffers must be aligned on DWORD32 boundaries. 7 - Buffers must be aligned on DWORD64 boundaries.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AdapterUsesPio
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter uses programmed I/O (PIO) and requires the use of system-space virtual addresses mapped to physical memory for data buffers. When this member is FALSE, the storage adapter does not use PIO.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AdapterScansDown
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter scans down for BIOS devices, that is, the storage adapter begins scanning with the highest device number rather than the lowest. When this member is FALSE, the storage adapter begins scanning with the lowest device number.
member.remarks: This member is reserved for legacy miniport drivers.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.CommandQueueing
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter supports SCSI tagged queuing and/or per-logical-unit internal queues, or the non-SCSI equivalent. When this member is FALSE, the storage adapter neither supports SCSI-tagged queuing nor per-logical-unit internal queues.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.AcceleratedTransfer
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the storage adapter supports synchronous transfers as a way of speeding up I/O. When this member is FALSE, the storage adapter does not support synchronous transfers as a way of speeding up I/O.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusType
member.summary: Specifies a value of type STORAGE_BUS_TYPE that indicates the type of the bus to which the device is connected.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusMajorVersion
member.summary: Specifies the major version number, if any, of the storage adapter.

member.name: F:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusMinorVersion
member.summary: Specifies the minor version number, if any, of the storage adapter.

member.name: P:AlphaOmega.Debug.Native.StorageAPI.STORAGE_ADAPTER_DESCRIPTOR.BusVersion
member.summary: Specifies the version number, if any, of the storage adapter.
